image.altText: men in handcuffs face a fence on the  floor as armed police stand behind them

props.synopsis: Investigators believe a group of men arrested by heavily armed police in Sydney's south-west yesterday have "extremist Islamic ideology" and may have been en route to Bondi.

title.children: Police say seven arrested in Liverpool have 'extremist Islamic ideology'

image.altText: People gather at North Bondi to paddle out

props.synopsis: Thousands of people gather at Bondi Beach to paddle out into the water to hold a minute's silence for the victims killed on Sunday.

title.children: Thousands at Bondi Beach for memorial service

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: More aggressive action needed over antisemitism, says former Israeli PM

image.altText: A man sits in front of a sign with ASIO written on it

props.synopsis: As Australia's intelligence agencies look back over how the Bondi attackers were missed, a "grim reality" of their jobs confronts the country.

title.children: ASIO's 'grim reality' as it picks over Bondi intelligence gaps

image.altText: A close up shot of a man dress in a black tshirt and cap.

props.synopsis: Steve Buttel says he told his bosses "it was only a matter of time" before there would be a terror attack on Bondi's Jewish community.

title.children: Former police sergeant claims he warned of Bondi attack a decade ago

image.altText: The front pages of several newspapers, all covering the mass shooting event at Bondi.

props.synopsis: The shock waves from Sunday's deadly terror attack at Bondi Beach have reverberated around the world from the Middle East to Moscow and Manila.

title.children: How the world reacted to the Bondi massacre

image.altText: A man with white hair receives a massage from a woman standing next to him while he attaches a watch to the wrist of another

props.synopsis: US Democrats continue their drip-feed of material from sex predator Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, releasing more photos on the eve of a deadline for the full publication of the Epstein files.

title.children: More photos released on eve of Epstein files deadline

image.altText: A man with short buzzed red hair wears dark grey-blue surgical scrubs while sitting in front of a laptop at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

title.children: Practice conditions put on neurosurgeon after behaviour complaints

image.altText: An illustration of a woman in work outfit popping out of a phone screen with farm in the background.

props.synopsis: Influencers push a false promise of easy money and a better life in Australia with a Work and Holiday Visa, inspiring young Indonesians to take extreme measures to chase an almost unrealisable dream.

title.children: Dream life in Australia sold by influencers doesn't match reality

image.altText: A cricketer in white kneels in front of the stumps, holding bat and helmet on

props.synopsis: England captain Ben Stokes stands between Australia and an imposing first-innings lead on day three of the third Ashes Test at the Adelaide Oval. Follow live.

title.children: Stokes battles on as Australia eyes big first-innings lead

image.altText: A pale man with silver hair frowns at the camera.

props.synopsis: Midwest WA residents could not reach Triple Zero amid a perfect storm of severe weather and fires, causing extended mobile and power outages.

title.children: 'If I was dying, I'd be dead': Calls for better backups as 000 calls fail

image.altText: blurred graffiti at Bald Hills Mosque

props.synopsis: Offensive words were also written on the Brisbane mosque, along with the swastika. WARNING: The following story contains an image of a Nazi symbol.

title.children: Queensland police investigating Nazi symbol graffitied on mosque

image.altText: Mum and dad with two teenagers, two young children, standing in front of home with water tank, green grass

props.synopsis: The Ballini family made the move to regional Queensland where they are are paying half the mortgage they were in the south-east, but that's rapidly changing.

title.children: Family cuts weekly mortgage payment to $330 with rural move

image.altText: Prince William, Princess Catherine and their children, George, Charlotte and Louis, sit in a field and smile

props.synopsis: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new family portrait to coincide with their annual Christmas card.

title.children: Prince William and Princess Catherine release 2025 Christmas card

image.altText: A soldier crouches down near the back of a tank. The soldier's back is to the camera.

props.synopsis: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

title.children: Inside the classified mission to deliver Australian tanks to Ukraine

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street is likely to send Australian stocks higher, as a soft inflation report feeds expectations for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Wall St gains on renewed Fed rate cut hopes, ASX to rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BoE cut rates to lowest level since early 2023
ECB holds rates steady, upgrades economic outlook
Trump Media group buys fusion power company for $9bn

image.altText: An aerial view of Ashley Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: Police say three of the seven youths who escaped the Ashley Youth Detention Centre last night are now back in custody.

title.children: Four youths still at large after staff stabbed in detention centre breakout

image.altText: A man in nautical outfit stands before a large ship amid ropes and a large group of people

props.synopsis: Master and Commander flopped in 2003 but is now hailed as a masterpiece. Discover why this epic is earning renewed respect.

title.children: 'Gladiator goes to sea': Russell Crowe on Master and Commander

image.altText: Two gold Chinese dragon heads as the head of a boat on a river.

props.synopsis: Braving 4am starts, the dragon boat team of The University of Philippines is full of dedicated athletes. But without being recognised as an official sport, they receive no pay for their time and sacrifice.

title.children: These dragon boat athletes are unpaid, but driven by community pride

image.altText: Jake Paul looks up at Anthony Joshua

props.synopsis: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua is not the first sham fight, neither will it be the last. But there is a real risk that, one way or another, it will have a lasting impact. Here's everything you need to know about the contest.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua fight

image.altText: A graphic featuring a woman with blonde hair, a sign for Philosopher Falls, a fern and a faint map.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

title.children: 'We've changed our theory': What recent discoveries say about Celine's last location

image.altText: A man and a woman stand on the alfresco of their incompete home.

props.synopsis: Almost two years after the slab went down, Jo and David Dimov's "forever home" is still unfinished. The couple is part of a class action that has "snowballed" against a major WA builder.

title.children: Home owners could claim millions if class action against builder succeeds

image.altText: a woman walking in front of an old redbrick institutional building with a cane

props.synopsis: Wolston Park closed in 2001, but, for decades, it has been at the centre of disturbing allegations of abuse and chemical restraint. Now, patients' stories have been published alongside a report.

title.children: Patients detail historic abuse at notorious Brisbane mental hospital

image.altText: The Neo robot

props.synopsis: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

title.children: Humanoid robots are coming, but can they win our hearts and minds?

image.altText: Rita Saffioti gesturing to a chart on a TV.

props.synopsis: For most other governments, a $2.5 billion surplus would be news to shout from the rooftops — but in WA's case, it's a headache with little prospect of relief.

title.children: A $2.5 billion surplus has created a migraine for the WA government

image.altText: An old photo of a woman in a brown nun's habit.

props.synopsis: Former nun Mary Hughes alleges she was subjected to multiple forms of abuse during her 60 years at a Carmelite monastery in Melbourne.

title.children: Mary was looking for a noble life. Instead, she says she was caught in a fringe group

image.altText: A silhouetted corrections officer walks down a cell corridor in a prison.

props.synopsis: Police will be trusted to decide whether their own conduct was illegal during a secret prison bugging program, with prosecutors saying they will only reassess cases the force flags for review.

title.children: Police to decide on the legality of their own secret prison wiretaps

image.altText: A female student completes her exam using a laptop.

props.synopsis: As students mull over their 2025 ATAR results, experts say there are many ways to find a pathway into a desired degree, even if their number falls short.

title.children: What to do if you are disappointed with your ATAR result

image.altText: a drone shot showing a large mangrove forest connected to the sea.

props.synopsis: On the edge of the southern Great Barrier Reef, a dozen bulls graze peacefully on a riverbank, sharing the delicate wetlands with about 50 species of shorebirds. This unlikely combination is intentional and mutually beneficial.

title.children: This farm hides a delicate ecosystem where bulls and birds live in harmony

props.synopsis: Kenyan veterinarian David Munyua pulls off one of the great World Darts Championship upsets over Belgium's Mike De Decker.

title.children: Kenyan vet survives a wasp in the eye and huge odds to claim shock darts win

image.altText: A composite image showing a woman on the left and a man on the right with a dark background. Both are smiling

props.synopsis: As the political year winds up, Premier Peter Malinauskas and Liberal leader Ashton Hurn have much to contemplate over their Christmas lunch.

title.children: Christmas anxiety, political hubris and an upcoming state election

image.altText: A profile view of a man wearing a black baseball cap and orange hi-vis vest

props.synopsis: An Australian man is sentenced to 12 years in a Bali prison for his role in trafficking cocaine into the country in Lindt chocolate wrappers.

title.children: Bali court sentences Lamar Ahchee to 12 years for role in cocaine smuggling plot

image.altText: Green Kenworth truck driving alongside parked suburban cars in a town.

props.synopsis: A western Victorian council says plans for a bypass might finally eventuate, as thousands of trucks travel through the city of Horsham each day amid an industrial boom.

title.children: Victorian council hopes bypass might finally happen after 80-year wait

image.altText: A photo of a man and woman in front of a Zone RV caravan.

props.synopsis: People who fully paid before the company collapsed can receive their vans if they pay an extra fee, while the majority of customers remain in limbo.

title.children: Administrators allow some Zone RV customers to collect caravans
